main event: A round, white object was sighted near Klamath Falls, Oregon on April 28, 1953.
interesting points: The object appeared to be in a dive and disappeared behind a mountain top.
The object was described as being brighter and larger than a typical falling star or meteorite.
The sighting lasted for about 5 minutes.
No meteorological or other conditions were known that could have caused the sighting.
No interception or identification action was taken by the Air Force.
